data.scheme_name: Uttarakhand Startup Policy, 2023 - Ease of doing business
data.benefits: Exemptions from compliances like certifications and Inspection.
data.eligibility:
The entity should : 

  • Be a separate legal entity with operations not exceeding 10 years. 
  • Have Annual turnover less than Rs. 100 crore since incorporation. 
  • Not be formed by splitting/reconstruction or part of a family business/conglomerate.
data.conditions:
• Should be recognized by the Uttarakhand Startup Task Force. 
  • Entity shall have an office in Uttarakhand and should have significant operation of business from Uttarakhand. 
  • Entity shall be employ at least 70% of its overall full-time workforce (workforce shall include founder, cofounders, support staff, skilled staff working on company payroll) having a domicile of Uttarakhand during the entire period of recognition.
data.beneficiaries:
The entity should : 

  • Be a separate legal entity with operations not exceeding 10 years. 
  • Have Annual turnover less than Rs. 100 crore since incorporation. 
  • Not be formed by splitting/reconstruction or part of a family business/conglomerate.
data.prerequisites:
• Should be recognized by the Uttarakhand Startup Task Force. 
  • Entity shall have an office in Uttarakhand and should have significant operation of business from Uttarakhand. 
  • Entity shall be employ at least 70% of its overall full-time workforce (workforce shall include founder, cofounders, support staff, skilled staff working on company payroll) having a domicile of Uttarakhand during the entire period of recognition.
data.nodal_agency: Directorate of Industries, Department of MSME
data.context: In the wake of the drastic changes in the economic environment as result of pandemic across the world, it has become inevitable to design exemplary measures to support home grown startup enterprises. Thus, with an objective to address the need of promoting innovations and entrepreneurship in solving the complex societal problems and to support key stakeholders of startup ecosystem, the "Uttarakhand Startup Policy 2023‚Äù has been  brought in to force.
data.objective: The objective of this policy is to create a culture of innovation and entrepreneurship by establishing a robust startup ecosystem in the state.
data.description:
Starting a business involves getting various departmental approval and clearances. Thus, it is very important that state government should work out a plan to minimize the regulatory compliances, punitive actions and provide support/awareness to these propellers of next stage economic growth. 

The State Government shall enhance the ease of doing business by minimizing inspections and encouraging self- certifications. All recognized startups shall become eligible for exemption from inspection on sell-certification basis for a period of five years from the date of recognition under the following acts: 

(i) The Factories Act,1948 

(ii) Shops and Establishment Act, 

(iii) The Maternity Benefit Act, 1961 

(iv) The Contract Labour (Regulations and Abolition) Act,1970 

(v) The Payment of Wages Act,1936

 (vi) The Minimum Wages Act, 1948

 (vi) The Employment Exchange Act, 1959

 (vii) Payment of Gratuity Act,1972

 (ix) Air (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act, 1981

 (x) Water (Prevention and Control of Pollution) Act,1974 

(xi) The Building and Other Construction Workers (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act, 1996

 (xii) The Inter-State Migrant Workmen (Regulation of Employment and Conditions of Service) Act, 1979

 (xiii) The Employees' Provident Funds and Miscellaneous Provisions Act, 1952

 (xiv) The Employees' State Insurance Act, 1948

 (xv) Any other Acts, Rules, Regulations notified in this regard by the state or central government. 

The exemptions under the above Acts shall be subjected to the complying with the due procedure specified by Startup India, Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade or by the concerned departments of state or central government or under the respective acts, rules or regulations.
data.how_to_apply:
The applicant can apply through the below link:
https://startuputtarakhand.uk.gov.in/signup
data.funding_facilitator: Directorate of Industries, Department of MSME
data.funding_mechanism: The applicant will get incentive after the approval of the application by the concerned authority.
data.additional_info:
Startups working on disruptive technologies. 

The qualification of startups working on disruptive technologies are as follows: 

  • Startups working on futuristic technologies: Startups that are working on futuristic technologies such as Neural Language Processing (NLP), Drones, Robotics, Defence, Aerospace, Space technologies, Fintech, MedTech, Healthtech to provide innovative solutions to the problem or challenges existing in the society or country. 
  • Startups working on Renewable energy: Startups helping to reduce carbon footprints through a renewable and sustainable source of energy using clean technologies or solutions such as Solar energy, Wind energy, Hydro energy, Tidal energy, Geothermal energy, Biomass energy etc. 
  • Startups working on Climate Change: Startups working in the area of eco-friendly and/or climate-friendly technologies/solutions that helps in reducing and offsetting carbon emissions or increasing the green cover in the region. 
  • Startup working on Circular Economy: Startups working in the four Rs of the circular economy namely: (a.) Reuse: Cloth collection, circular fashion, second-handproducts etc. (b.) Recycle: Recycled plastic, bottles, construction with recyclable materials etc. (c.) Reduce: Packaging with sustainable material, edible cutlery etc. (d.) Remove: Urban farming, use of fossil fuel, carbon capturing etc. 
  • Startup working on Sustainability: A startup working on green and sustainable practices along with next generation cutting edge technologies, processes or solutions that are enabling the world at large to recover from years of overuse such as 
  • (a.) improving the soil's health (b.) protection of endangered species (c.) protection of the ocean's biodiversity (d.) clean technologies for alternative energy sources (e.) clean technologies for water conservation and ground water recharging (f.) plantation and conservation of trees to increase green cover in particular region (g.) disaster management etc.
data.checklist_info_a:
-Basic KYC documents 
-ITR, P&L, B/S of last 3 FY and current FY (Till date) 
-Business incorporation letter / Company registration certificate 
-CIBIL Report 
-Business Project Report 
-Business Plan (Business model, promoter profile, and projected financials)
